scenes.title: Outer Trail
scenes.text: Beyond the last stone marker, the land loosens into scrub and wind. Paths braid and unbraid between low ridges.

choices.text: Follow the marked cut and show your permit.

effects.text: You keep to the posted line. The marker accepts your seal without drama.

effects.text: The air feels steadier around you, like a quiet hand on the shoulder.

choices.text: Sense a growing danger in the wilds.

effects.text: The wilderness stops feeling indifferent. Small things move with purpose now.

text: You set your pace and let the day pull you forward.

scenes.title: Moving Eyes
scenes.text: A sound carries wrong through the scrub—metal on leather, voices that don't belong to the wind. Something is sweeping the trail behind you.

choices.text: Slip into the scrub and let the sweep pass by.

effects.text: You become part of the brush. The voices move on, arguing quietly about shadows.
A branch snaps under your heel. The sweep hesitates—then continues, a little more awake than before.
You move at the wrong moment. A shout cuts the air—then the scrub swallows you anyway, leaving you scraped and breathing hard.

choices.text: Slip into the scrub—fast, before the sweep closes in.

effects.text: You vanish at the edge of their attention. Whoever's leading the sweep doesn't get the satisfaction of certainty.
You escape, but you feel it—the sweep learns something about your habits.
You take a hit of panic and pay for it in noise. You still get away—but the sweep won't be as lazy next time.

effects.text: You give them a story that fits the day. They accept it because it's easier than chasing ghosts.

scenes.title: Past the Watcher
scenes.text: The watcher is gone, but their presence lingers in the air. The trail continues, but feels different now.

choices.text: Continue deeper into the wilderness.

effects.text: You press on, keeping your path imperfect on purpose.

choices.text: Turn back toward town.

effects.text: You decide the wilderness has tested you enough for now.

scenes.title: Ridge Marker
scenes.text: A weathered post stands where the ridge pinches tight. A faded seal is carved deep enough to outlast opinions.

choices.text: Continue through without lingering.

effects.text: You pass cleanly. The ridge keeps its silence.

scenes.title: Stone-Snare
scenes.text: Loose rock waits under thin scrub. The slope remembers old slides—and seems ready to rehearse one.

choices.text: Brace and drive through the shifting stones.

effects.text: You bully the slope into letting you pass.
The stones bite, and the noise travels. You still make it through.
You go down hard—then the slide loses interest. You crawl clear, rattled but moving.

choices.text: Trace a calming mark and ask the slope to settle.

effects.text: Pebbles settle as if listening. A narrow lane holds long enough to pass.
Your pattern holds unevenly. Enough to slip through without the hill taking more.
Your mark skitters. The slope answers with a shove. You scramble through, leaving a loud story behind.

choices.text: Read the stones and pick the one stable line.

effects.text: You step where the ridge is least hungry.
A stone rolls, but you catch yourself and keep moving.
The ridge lies with every stone. You still get through—just not quietly.

choices.text: Move like the wind: light steps, no sudden weight.

effects.text: You pick the quiet stones. The slope never finds a reason to wake.

The slide whispers, then snaps loud. You're through, bruised and annoyed.

effects.text: You move like you're late for something. The ridge keeps your secret.

scenes.title: Beyond the Ridge
scenes.text: On the far side, the wind changes. The ground levels out, and the scrub grows thicker—good for hiding, bad for surprises.

choices.text: Circle back while the day still belongs to you.

effects.text: You turn back with new knowledge in your bones.

choices.text: Press on toward the wilderness edge.

effects.text: You take a few more careful minutes, letting the wilderness show its next page.

scenes.title: A Shift In The Air
text: The road behind you becomes noise, then memory.
Ahead, the day feels almost ordinary—until you notice how often the same details repeat.

choices.text: Enter and keep your pace steady.

text: You move like you belong here.
If anything is watching, it gets only a clean, simple story.

choices.text: Enter, then slow down long enough to read the flow.

text: You pause just long enough to see where people gather and where they avoid.
